title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Bedford County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Bedford County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

title: Florida DOT Removal of Street Art

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida DOT Removal of Street Art
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The Department of Transportation issued to a statement to CNN, which reported (at https://www.cnn.com/2025/08/22/us/pulse-orlando-removal-rainbow-crosswalk-hnk):

“Last week, local governments not in compliance for local roads began receiving notifications to bring their roadways up to state standards to ensure locals govern themselves accordingly,” the department told CNN in a statement. “In addition to ensuring all local governments comply, FDOT completed a review of all state-maintained roadways and is now correcting pavement markings not in compliance. That includes street art previously installed on state right of way, such as the intersection of Orange Avenue in question.”

I request a copy of all the "notifications to bring their roadways up to state standards" with respect to "pavement markings" or "street art" as referenced by the Department's statement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Makea Stream Bridge (FEMA Project #72603)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Makea Stream Bridge (FEMA Project #72603)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide any and all documentation and correspondence received by or transmitted to the Hawaii County Public Works Department regarding the “Makea Stream Bridge” located in Pepeekeo, Hi.  Also, any and all documentation and correspondence with the state of Hawaii Emergency Management Agency regarding the “Makea Stream Bridge” located in Pepeekeo, Hi.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Donald F Rudny

communications.subject: FOIA Request Number [2023-FEFO-00868] Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
07/20/2023                       SENT VIA E-MAIL TO: 149531-91350521@requests.muckrock.comRe:       FOIA Request Number 2023-FEFO-00868            Acknowledgment Dear Donald Rudny:This correspondence acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), dated 7/19/2023 and received in this office on 7/19/2023.  You are seeking any and all documentation and correspondence received by or transmitted to the Hawaii County Public Works Department regarding the “Makea Stream Bridge” located in Pepeekeo, Hi. Also, any and all documentation and correspondence with the state of Hawaii Emergency Management Agency regarding the “Makea Stream Bridge” located in Pepeekeo, Hi. 
Your request has been assigned the following tracking number 2023-FEFO-00868. Please be advised that we have queried the FEMA organizations which may have responsive records.  However, we will be in touch with you soon for more details about the types of documents you are seeking.   If you have any questions or would like to discuss this matter, please contact the assigned FOIA specialist directly at, juan.vegasandoval@fema.dhs.gov and reference the request number 2023-FEFO-00868.  Again, If you require additional support, you may also contact FEMA’s Public Liaison at FEMA-FOIA@fema.dhs.gov.  If you need to contact FEMA’s FOIA Public Liaison, then please reference the FOIA request number and address your email to “Attn: FEMA’s Public Liaison” and summarize your concerns. You may also contact FEMA at (202) 646-3323, or you may contact FEMA’s Public Liaison in the same manner.  Please reference FOIA request number 2023-FEFO-00868.For a faster response please communicate by email.  Thank you for your interest in FEMA. Sincerely, Disclosure BranchInformation Management DivisionOffice of the Chief Administrative OfficerFederal Emergency Management AgencyU.S. Department of Homeland Security

communications.subject: Public records request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I am an attorney in the County Counsel's office assigned to advise the District Attorneys Office on civil matters.  We have received your public records act request.  Of note, the attachment states a date of October 30, but it was sent to us via Muckrock on November 19.

The request as stated is overbroad and unduly burdensome.  A search of all District Attorney email communications for the words "prostitution," "sex trafficking" and "human trafficking" for an 11 year period would result in an unreasonably large volume of communication on every case touching upon these issues, as well as every training or discussion on these topics across a large office.  Much of that material would be exempt from disclosure under the CPRA, but working through each document to determine which were not exempt would take years, and is impracticable.

I would like to help identify the specific documents that are of use to you, so that we can make a targeted search.  Let me know if it would help to discuss over the phone.

[cid:image001.png@01DC5AC5.61298380]
Hilary Kerrigan | Deputy County Counsel
Office of the County Counsel, County of Santa Clara
70 West Hedding, East Wing, 9th Floor | San José, CA 95110
Office: (408) 299-5925  Mobile: (626) 319-0136
Hilary.Kerrigan@cco.sccgov.org<mailto:Hilary.Kerrigan@cco.sccgov.org> | counsel.sccgov.org<https://counsel.sccgov.org/>
Pronouns: she/her/hers

NOTICE TO RECIPIENT: The information in this email is confidential and may be protected by the attorney-client and/or work product privileges. If you received this email in error, any review, use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of it is strictly prohibited.  Please notify Administration, Office of the County Counsel, of the error immediately at 408-299-5900 and delete this communication and any attached documents from your system.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: California Public Records Act Request: PPR SCC DA 10.2025
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Doogan,

Thank you for speaking to me on the phone just now.  I understand that your main interest is in learning about the specific cases prosecuted in our County related to the topics you identified.  As I mentioned over the phone, we do not release protected personal identifying information under the California Constitution, nor do we release protected criminal history information or identities of victims under the Penal Code.  If you are interested in deidentified or aggregate data, please let me know the details and I can determine whether such data exists, or alternatively whether it can be extracted via computer programming for a fee.  You can also review the District Attorney's data dashboard here:  Santa Clara County DA Dashboard<https://data.dacalifornia.org/santa-clara>
The DA's website has reports, data, and policies on various topics here:  Publications and policies | Office of the District Attorney | County of Santa Clara<https://da.santaclaracounty.gov/publications/publications-and-policies>

As I explained to you, we do not have a method to run a key word search for documents across the District Attorney's Office generally and I will need you to describe what you are looking for before I am able to search for and identify potentially responsive public records.  You were unable to articulate a focused request over the phone, though I spent many minutes describing to you the various categories of available records, and attempting to redirect you from your insistence on a broad keyword search.  To the degree a keyword search is your primary objective, you can search the County ordinance code here: Code of Ordinances | Santa Clara County, CA | Municode Library<https://library.municode.com/ca/santa_clara_county/codes/code_of_ordinances>, you can review the Board of Supervisors policy manual here:  Board of Supervisors Policy Manual | Office of the Clerk of the Board of Supervisors | County of Santa Clara<https://cob.santaclaracounty.gov/governing-documents/board-supervisors-policy-manual>, and you can search meetings, agendas, and related materials for the Board of Supervisors here:  Board of Supervisors Policy Manual | Office of the Clerk of the Board of Supervisors | County of Santa Clara<https://cob.santaclaracounty.gov/governing-documents/board-supervisors-policy-manual>  The search term "human trafficking" on the last of these resources garnered 3,501 results when I searched just now, so there should be ample material for your preliminary review there.

Please reach out if you formulate a more focused request upon review the above.  In the meantime, we consider this request to be closed.

[cid:image001.png@01DC5AFB.3E5B6360]
Hilary Kerrigan | Deputy County Counsel
Office of the County Counsel, County of Santa Clara
70 West Hedding, East Wing, 9th Floor | San José, CA 95110
Office: (408) 299-5925  Mobile: (626) 319-0136
Hilary.Kerrigan@cco.sccgov.org<mailto:Hilary.Kerrigan@cco.sccgov.org> | counsel.sccgov.org<https://counsel.sccgov.org/>
Pronouns: she/her/hers

NOTICE TO RECIPIENT: The information in this email is confidential and may be protected by the attorney-client and/or work product privileges. If you received this email in error, any review, use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of it is strictly prohibited.  Please notify Administration, Office of the County Counsel, of the error immediately at 408-299-5900 and delete this communication and any attached documents from your system.

title: restricted access school library

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: restricted access school library
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges: 

https://www.williamsonscene.com/news/wcs-board-removes-three-books-restricts-access-for-two-in-school-libraries/article_a7305bc6-b74e-11ef-af14-03bf747b756b.html

Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “tennessee book ban law”, “state law implementation”, “restricts access”, “sexually explicit”, “policy revision”, “porn”, or “materials policy”. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discuss book bans B) any other document that has been used to help explain book bans, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “the perks of being a wallflower”, “where the crawdads sing”, “walk two moons”, “curriculum removed”, “extremely loud & incredibly close”, or “speak”.

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning “tennessee book ban law”, “state law implementation”, “restricts access”, “sexually explicit”, “policy revision”, “porn”, or “materials policy”.

Please perform this search for records between Sept 1 2024 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Claire Woodcock.

communications.subject: Records Request
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

My name is Zachary Owens and I am the paralegal for Williamson County Schools. You will need to submit a records request using the form on our website I have linked it https://www.wcs.edu/about-us/administrative-procedures-forms/public-records-request. Once you submit it the form will go to my email automatically. I will also need you to email me a copy of your TN ID . A requestor must be a Tennessee resident pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act. Tenn. Code Ann § 10-7-503(a)(2)(A).

Thank you,
Zachary Owens
Paralegal

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Geauga County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Geauga County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Flagler County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Flagler County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Budget (South Charleston Police)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Attached please find the City of South Charleston’s adopted budget document for Fiscal Year 2024–2025, as prepared and submitted in accordance with the requirements of the West Virginia State Auditor’s Office. This document represents the official, itemized budget format required by the State Auditor and reflects how departmental appropriations, including the Police Department’s budget, are presented and approved.

In addition, I have attached the Police Department’s internal line-item expenditure budget proposal for the fiscal year, which details the approved expenditure categories comprising the Police Department’s total budgeted amount.

Please note that the City does not further break down or internally itemize revenue sources beyond what is presented in the West Virginia State Auditor–approved budget document.

To the extent you are seeking underlying accounting records or expenditure detail beyond the adopted and approved budget documents (i.e., transactional or accounting-level support), those records are available for in-person inspection in accordance with the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act. Please contact our office to arrange a time during normal business hours should you wish to review additional records.
Sincerely,

Kris Taylor, CPA, CICA
Assistant City Treasurer
City of South Charleston
(304) 720-5985

title: Five Below – Final Enforcement and Compliance Records (2025)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Five Below – Final Enforcement and Compliance Records (2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to document the existence, status, and outcomes of regulatory inspections, compliance determinations, and enforcement actions involving Five Below, Inc. locations in Michigan during calendar year 2025, as administered by the Michigan Department of Agriculture and Rural Development (MDARD).

This request is limited to pricing-related inspections and compliance activity conducted under the Shopping Reform and Modernization Act and related pricing statutes.

Specifically, I request records sufficient to show:

The total number of pricing inspections conducted at Five Below locations in Michigan during calendar year 2025.

The number of inspections resulting in “Not In Compliance” determinations.

The number of inspections resulting in “In Compliance” determinations.

Records sufficient to indicate whether any enforcement action, settlement, assurance of discontinuance/compliance, or other formal resolution was finalized or executed in connection with these inspections.

Records sufficient to show the dates on which final compliance determinations or closures were issued.

This request seeks summary-level, outcome-level, or final administrative records only and does not seek underlying investigative workpapers or materials exempt from disclosure.

I am not requesting:

Personally identifying information of complainants or witnesses.

Ongoing or open investigative materials.

Attorney-client privileged communications.

Internal deliberative or pre-decisional documents.

Drafts or internal legal strategy materials.

If any portion of this request is denied, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon and release all reasonably segregable, non-exempt portions.

I request responsive records in electronic format where available.

This request is made for informational and public oversight purposes and is not for commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Public Records Request Desk

title: First Amendment Trainings for Federal Law-Enforcement Officers (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: First Amendment Trainings for Federal Law-Enforcement Officers (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020.

2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings.

3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in (1). For example, this could be a receipt or contract for an outside vendor or speaker, or it could be a dated sign-in sheet from the training.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-56528
communications.communication:
08/27/2025 

Adam  Steinbaugh 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR191862 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICFO-56528 
 
Dear Requester: 

This acknowledges receipt of your 8/25/2025, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for records pertaining to: 1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020; 
2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings; and 
3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in.  Your request was received in this office on 8/25/2025. 

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you’re able to narrow the scope of your request please contact our office. Narrowing the scope may speed up the search process. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. 

Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations as they apply to non-commercial requesters.  As a non-commercial requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free, as are the first two hours of search time, after which you will pay the per quarter-hour rate ($4.00 for clerical personnel, $7.00 for professional personnel, $10.25 for managerial personnel) of the searcher.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. 

We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at 500 12th Street, SW, Washington DC 20536 or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-ICFO-56528. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-56528
communications.communication:
Adam  Steinbaugh 
N/A 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR191862 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICFO-56528 

Dear Requester: 

This letter is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), dated 8/25/2025.  You have requested records pertaining to: 1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020; 
2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings; and 
3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in. ICE has considered your request under the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552. 

ICE considered the foreseeable harm standard when reviewing the record set and has applied the FOIA exemptions as required by the statute and the Attorney General’s Guidance. 

A search of the ICE Office of Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) for records responsive to your request produced 5 pages that are responsive to your request.  After review of those documents, I have determined portions of 5 pages will be withheld pursuant to Exemptions of the FOIA as described below. 

ICE has applied FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7(C) to protect from disclosure the names, e-mail addresses, and phone numbers of DHS employees, as well as other third-party information contained within the documents. 

FOIA Exemption 6 exempts from disclosure personnel or medical files and similar files the release of which would cause a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This requires a balancing of the public’s right to disclosure against the individual’s right to privacy.  The privacy interests of the individuals in the records you have requested outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into the aforementioned balancing test. 

FOIA Exemption 7(C) protects records or information compiled for law enforcement purposes that could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This exemption takes particular note of the strong interests of individuals, whether they are suspects, witnesses, or investigators, in not being unwarrantably associated with alleged criminal activity.  That interest extends to persons who are not only the subjects of the investigation, but those who may have their privacy invaded by having their identities and information about them revealed in connection with an investigation.  Based upon the traditional recognition of strong privacy interest in law enforcement records, categorical withholding of information that identifies third parties in law enforcement records is ordinarily appropriate.  As such, I have determined that the privacy interest in the identities of individuals in the records you have requested clearly outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Please note that any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into this determination. 

ICE has applied FOIA Exemption 7(E) to protect from disclosure internal agency case numbers and internal agency URLs contained within the document. 

FOIA Exemption 7(E) protects records compiled for law enforcement purposes, the release of which would disclose techniques and/or procedures for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions, or would disclose guidelines for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions if such disclosure could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  I have determined that disclosure of certain law enforcement sensitive information contained within the responsive records could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  Additionally, the techniques and procedures at issue are not well known to the public. 

You have a right to appeal the above withholding determination.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.8. You may submit your appeal electronically at GILDFOIAAppeals@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail to: 

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security 
500 12th Street, S.W., Mail Stop 5900 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5900 

Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge. 

If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009.  Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Sincerely, 

Megan Davis 
Deputy FOIA Officer, Operations 

Enclosure(s):	5 Pages 
Note: If you are receiving this message by email and responsive records are not included as an attachment to the email, please log in to your SecureRelease portal account to view the responsive records.

title: Applications and information regarding Vidler Water Company etc.

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Applications and information regarding Vidler Water Company etc.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of all proposals and applications for water rights (surface and groundwater) submitted by Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton and any company submitting on behalf of Vidler Water Company and/or D.R. Horton between 1980 to 2025.
2.  A copy of all water rights leased, purchased, sold or transferred by Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton between 1980 to 2025.
3. A copy of all wells owned and operated (on public, private or BLM lands) by Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer and  D.R. Horton. 
4. A copy of all well drilling permits, well monitoring reports and/or materials referenced in applications submitted by Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton and any company submitting on behalf of Vidler Water Company and/or D.R. Horton between 2000 to 2025.
5. Copies of all emails, phone calls, teams and/or text messages from Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton and any company on their behalf regarding water rights permits, projects or applications regarding proof of beneficial use and/or resumption.
6. A copy of all proof of beneficial use of water rights applications submitted by Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton and any company on their behalf between 2020 to 2025.
7. A copy of all protests filed against Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton and any company on their behalf and the responses to the request.
8. A copy of all public comments or complaints regarding Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer,  D.R. Horton and any company submitting on behalf of Vidler Water Company and/or D.R. Horton. 
9. A copy of all petitions for review of canceled permits and/or renewing water rights. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Vivien Fleck

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Applications and information regarding Vidler Water Company etc.
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Fleck,

Thank you for your follow-up regarding your public records request submitted on October 13, 2025. I’d like to clarify that in my previous correspondence, I indicated we would provide an update by November 14, not a completed response. Given the size and complexity of your request, as well as the Division’s current workload, we will require additional time to complete our review and compilation of responsive records.

In the meantime, we are providing a list that we believe is responsive to Parts 1 and 2 of your request. This list includes: (a) water rights or applications for water rights submitted by Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer, and D.R. Horton (the “named entities”); and (b) water rights for which we have a record of purchase, sale, or transfer involving one or more of these entities.

Please note that this list does not distinguish between Part 1 and Part 2 of your request; the information is combined. If you would prefer that the information be separated by request item, please let us know and we will do our best to accommodate.

We are not providing copies of applications or permits at this time, as those documents are publicly accessible through the Division’s online permit search tool, available here: https://tools.water.nv.gov/PermitSearch.aspx

If you are seeking more than just the application or permit (e.g., the entire permit file), please let us know. If a permit file is already in electronic format, we can provide it pursuant to NRS 239.010(4). If it is not available electronically, you may inspect the file in person at our office. Please note that providing full copies of permit files will require additional time.

We also have several clarifying questions regarding the remainder of your request (Parts 3–9):

  *   Part 3: You request “a copy of all wells owned.” The Division does not track well ownership directly, but rather manages water rights, which include points of diversion such as wells. If you are seeking information about points of diversion, those can be viewed in the applications and permits available through the online database linked above.
  *   Part 4: This request includes several components:
     *   (a) The Division does not issue a document formally titled as “well drilling permit.” Instead, we process Notices of Intent (NOIs) to drill wells and receive well logs after drilling. If you are seeking well logs associated with wells held by the named entities, you may search by owner using our well log database here: https://tools.water.nv.gov/WellLogQuery.aspx. Please let us know if you have any questions, need assistance, or if this does not satisfy this portion of your request.
     *   (b) Regarding “well monitoring reports,” we issue monitoring waivers for the drilling of/conversion to monitoring wells and receive some depth-to-water measurements for those wells. We also receive pumpage reports for certain wells. Could you please clarify whether you are requesting submitted pumpage reports, depth-to-water data, or both? If you are seeking water level data, you may find it through our water level database here: https://tools.water.nv.gov/WaterLevelData.aspx
     *   (c) The phrase “materials referenced in applications” is quite broad. Could you please specify what types of materials you are seeking?
  *   Part 7: You request “a copy of all protests” filed against the named entities. The permit search database referenced above also includes a tab labeled “Abrogations/Protests/Rulings” that can be used to view protest information, if an application was protested. This can be used in combination with the list we’ve provided in response to Parts 1 and 2.
  *   Part 9: You request “a copy of all petitions for review of canceled permits.” Could you confirm whether this request is limited to petitions involving Vidler Water Company, Dorothy Timian-Palmer, and D.R. Horton?

Once we receive clarification on the above items, we will be able to provide an updated timeline for processing the remainder of your request. In the meantime, we will continue working on it to the best of our ability.

We appreciate your patience and cooperation as we work to fulfill this request. Please don’t hesitate to reach out with clarifications or preferences regarding the format or scope of the records you are seeking.
Best regards,



[cid:image001.jpg@01DC5553.1B210E70]<http://water.nv.gov/>

James Henson, Esq.
Chief Administrative Law Judge | Hearings Section
Nevada Division of Water Resources
Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
901 S. Stewart Street, Suite 2002, Carson City, Nevada 89701
jhenson@water.nv.gov<mailto:jhenson@water.nv.gov>
Office: 775-684-2882

[cid:image002.jpg@01DC5553.1B210E70]<https://dcnr.nv.gov/>

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Applications and information regarding Vidler Water Company etc.
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Fleck,

Thank you for your patience as we worked to process your public records request submitted on October 13, 2025. We provided an interim update on November 14, 2025, and this email constitutes our final response.

The records responsive to your request are available for download at the following FTP link: https://dcnrftp.ndep.nv.gov/public/folder/dnwf06akwkkyygunckssnw/PRR%20-%20Muckrock. This link provides access to all records indicated below.

We are providing records responsive to Parts 5, 6, and 8 of your request as follows:

PART 5 – Copies of Emails, Phone Calls, Teams, and/or Text Messages

We have located and are providing emails responsive to this portion of your request. In addition, we are including two call logs. Please note that these logs have been REDACTED to remove non-responsive portions (e.g., calls unrelated to the named entities).

PART 6 – Proof of Beneficial Use Applications (2020–2025)

We located two certificated water rights responsive to this request. These are Permit 80648, Certificate 19594, and Permit 80649, Certificate 19595.

These records do not appear to exist in an electronic format and are not required to be created in such a format pursuant to NRS 239.010(4). However, you may visit our Carson City office, where the front desk will make the records available for your inspection.

Additionally, you may search our Permits Database by owner name. Under the Maps and Due Dates tab, you can identify any additional permits that may have been certificated by the named entities. Here is a link to the Permits Database: Permit Search<http://ndwrintranet/permitsearch>.

PART 8 – Public Comments or Complaints Regarding Named Entities

We conducted an electronic search of our database for instances of the three named entities within 10 words of the terms “comment” or “complaint.” This search returned zero matches.

If you believe a specific hearing included a comment or complaint concerning one of the named entities, please let us know. That information may help us focus the request further. However, based on our current search, we have not located any responsive records.

Because we did not receive clarification on the remaining portions of your request (Parts 3, 4, 7, and 9), we consider this response COMPLETE and the matter CLOSED.

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or wish to submit a new request with additional details.
Best regards,


[cid:image001.jpg@01DC8F8F.A4AD5330]<http://water.nv.gov/>

James Henson, Esq.
Chief Administrative Law Judge | Hearings Section
Nevada Division of Water Resources
Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
901 S. Stewart Street, Suite 2002, Carson City, Nevada 89701
jhenson@water.nv.gov<mailto:jhenson@water.nv.gov>
Office: 775-684-2882

[cid:image002.jpg@01DC8F8F.A4AD5330]<https://dcnr.nv.gov/>

Since January 1, 2025, please provide records, by month, for the number of violations forwarded by Verra for law enforcement review, and the number of violations disapproved by law enforcement, and the total monthly law enforcement approval rate of violations transmitted by Verra for law enforcement review

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith

communications.subject: FOIL response
communications.communication:
Dear Riford Family:


           In response to your FOIL request received by this office on January 27, 2026 attached please find the April 7, 2009 meeting minutes being held in this office.



            You have a right to appeal this decision, should you desire, directly to the Chairman of the Niagara County Legislature, Niagara County Courthouse, 175 Hawley Street, Lockport, New York 14094. Such an appeal must be in writing. You must include a copy of both your original FOIL request and this department’s reply. You must serve the appeal notice within thirty (30) days of the date of this reply.



Danya





​Danya Scalzi​
Assistant Clerk of the Niagara County Legislature
(716)-439-7177


Notice: This electronic transmission is intended for the sole use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential, privileged or otherwise legally protected information. If you are not the intended recipient, or if you believe you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, disclosure, copying, distribution, or the taking of any action in reliance on the contents of this information, is strictly prohibited. Niagara County is not responsible for the content of any external hyperlink referenced in this email or any email. IF YOU HAVE RECEIVED THIS TRANSMISSION IN ERROR, PLEASE NOTIFY THE SENDER IMMEDIATELY BY EMAIL AND DELETE THE ORIGINAL MESSAGE ALONG WITH ANY PAPER OR ELECTRONIC COPIES. Thank you for your cooperation.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA requests and costs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	Request records of all FOIA requests during 2021 to the date of this request, related to FOIA estimates and charges paid. If any of the requested information for each FOIA is protected from release by law, please omit the protected information only and specifically cite the exemption. If this information is already contained in #2 that report may be acceptable.
2.	Records for FOIA’s process (excel spreadsheet format is acceptable) showing the following information. If this information is in a database for which reports can be exported, I am willing to take ALL FIELDS exported so there is no filtering required.

Id
Created At
Request Text
Due Date
Point of Contact
Request Date
Status
URL	
Visibility	
Closed Date	
Closure Reasons	
Format Received	
Tags	
First Contact Event	
Anticipated Fulfillment Date
Actual fulfillment date
Estimated cost to fill
Actual Cost to fill	
Expiration Date	
Requester Name	
Requester City	
Requester State	
Requester Zipcode	
Requester Company
Requester Email

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Message to requester
communications.communication:
After consultation with the individuals responsible for the information you requested, I have determined that the estimated cost of fulfilling your request is $103.09. As you may be aware, § 2.2-3704. F. of the Code of Virginia allows public bodies to charge for accessing, duplicating, supplying, redacting or searching for the requested records. This estimate reflects 2 hours of the FOIA assistant's time at an hourly rate of $23.33; 1 hour of a fiscal technician's time at an hourly rate of $23.33, and 0.5 hours of the FOIA officer's time at $66.20 per hour. This does not include any printing or mailing costs, if applicable.

Please let me know if you agree to the estimated cost. If you do, we will send you an invoice and, once we receive payment, will begin to process your request.

title: Flock Contracts (Hotchkiss Police Department)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Flock Contracts (Hotchkiss Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts and agreements between the Town of Hotchkiss (including the Hotchkiss Police Department) and Flock Safety or Flock Group, from 2020 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Fitzgerald

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Flock Contracts (Hotchkiss Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Colorado Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 22, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Flock Contracts (Hotchkiss Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello Christopher,

I did receive the request and we have been actively working on completing the request. My Admin Assistant Jeffrey Rodarte has been gathering the contracts today. I am going to attach him in the email so he can arrange getting you all the information. I appreciate your follow up. Jeffrey is off on Fridays so today was the first day he had a chance to work on it. If Jeffrey thinks we might need a little more time I will make sure we make the request in writing to advise the reason for the slight delay. My hope is to have it completed by tomorrow afternoon.

Chief Green

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

Good morning!

Attached are the two documents that I confirmed with Flock Safety representatives to be our contracts/agreements. The initial agreement began late 2022, with a contract extension(including sign trailer kit) order form filled out and signed in late 2024. The terms appear to be two year agreements so we should have another extension agreement later this year.

I hope this accurately fulfills your request,
Thank you!

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jacqueline Watkins, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. title: LADWP

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LADWP
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

To: Records Custodian
Los Angeles Department of Water and Power (LADWP)
CPRA@ladwp.com

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (CPRA) (California Government Code § 6250 et seq.), I am requesting access to and copies of any and all records related to the functionality, capacity, and vulnerabilities of the fire hydrant system in the Greater Los Angeles area. Specifically, I am seeking information that pertains to the following:
	1.	Hydrant System Vulnerabilities and Capacity:
	•	Reports, memos, studies, assessments, or internal communications related to the fire hydrant system’s operational readiness, capacity, and performance.
	•	Any documented concerns, limitations, or vulnerabilities identified in the fire hydrant system, including but not limited to water pressure issues, dry hydrants, or insufficient flow rates.
	2.	Testing and Evaluations:
	•	Records of any testing, inspections, or evaluations conducted on fire hydrants and related infrastructure.
	•	Results of flow tests, pressure evaluations, or other performance measures specific to fire hydrants in Los Angeles and surrounding areas.
	3.	Awareness of Potential Failures:
	•	Any communications, emails, or reports between LADWP and other government agencies (e.g., Los Angeles Fire Department, City of Los Angeles officials, California State Water Resources Control Board) discussing the fire hydrant systems.
	•	Documents, communications or analyses that acknowledge or outline the risks, concerns and vulneralbiliteis  of the fire hydrant system.
	4.	Mitigation and Preparedness Plans:
	•	Any plans, proposals, or discussions regarding efforts to upgrade or address potential vulnerabilities in the fire hydrant system prior to recent fires.
	•	Funding allocations, budgets, or grants related to improving fire hydrant infrastructure or emergency water systems.

Format of Records:
If possible, I request that the records be provided in electronic format (e.g., PDFs, spreadsheets) and sent via email. Please include any metadata associated with electronic records, such as file creation and modification dates.

Time Frame:
I am requesting records from January 1, 2020, to the present to capture a comprehensive history of planning, testing, and discussions regarding the fire hydrant system.

Fee Waiver Request (If Applicable):
If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me before processing it. I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest and contributes to understanding the functionality of critical infrastructure during emergencies.

Under the California Public Records Act (CPRA), Government Code § 6253(c), the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power (LADWP) is required to respond to this request within 10 calendar days of receipt. The response must include:
	1.	Acknowledgment of the Request: Confirmation that the request has been received.
	2.	Determination of Records Availability: A decision regarding whether the requested records exist and can be disclosed.
	3.	Notification of Extension (if applicable): If additional time is needed to locate or compile the requested records, LADWP may extend the response time by an additional 14 calendar days, as permitted by law, provided that you notify me in writing of the reason for the extension.

Should LADWP fail to respond within this statutory timeframe or deny the request without valid legal grounds, it may be considered a violation of the CPRA, and I reserve the right to seek remedies under the law.

Thanks, 
Eric Scharfenberger

title: WA State DOC trans information

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The total number of transgender inmates currently in the WA State DOC system. Also let me know how that breaks down between trans women and trans men. I'd like to know what facility you send trans women to, and which one you send trans men to. I'd also like to know how many trans inmates are housed in isolation/solitary confinement vs. some sort of general housing situation. And I would like this breakdown to cover the years 2010-2020. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Allen

communications.subject: P-20269
communications.communication:
April 29, 2021


Adam:

I am writing to acknowledge receipt of you public records request sent April 23, 2021.  For future reference, your request has been assigned public records tracking number, P-20269.  You have requested:

1.      The total number of transgender individuals who are currently incarcerated in a DOC facility broken down by "trans men" and "trans women".
2.      What facility DOC houses trans individuals at.
3.      Number of transgender individuals housed in solitary confinement and/or isolation from 2010-2020.

If I have captured any portion of your request incorrectly, please let me know.  A public records request is a request for identifiable public records, where DOC has a record that answers your questions, we will provide it.

Due to a temporary restraining order granted by the Court in Does v. DOC, et al: USDC Cause No. 4:21-cv-05059, the Department will not be producing any records until the Court rules on whether or not to grant a preliminary injunction.

I will follow up with you after the Court's decision regarding the production of any records responsive to your request.

Sincerely,
Denise Vaughan

Denise Vaughan, Information Governance Director
Administrative Operations Division
Department of Corrections
(360) 725-8854 (office)

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information
communications.communication:
Hi Ms Vaughan: Thank you for your quick response. I have to admit to being curious about the court case. When I put in the whole title ("Does v....-05059) I got something in MIssouri. The only other thing I could fin is a recent court case where plaintiffs asked for a mandamus writ to instruct the executive branch to prioritize categories of inmates at high risk for COVID as well as balancing community safety and other release factors they normally take into account. 

You've gotten my request right. Partly I'm asking because even though I've talked to several other trans activists, none of them seem to know where trans men are sent. From what I hear, trans women are usually sent to Monroe CC. But I wonder if it's always been that way? Or if there are plans to do something different in the future. That's part of why I asked for such a long timeframe. 

Thanks,

Adam

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information

Sincerely,

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information
communications.communication:
Hi Ms. Vaughan: I'm confused. Can you clarify something for me please? Is this case and injunction related to inmate files and what information is given out through FOIA? Or is it directly related to trans issues? I can't find it with an internet search. Are you allowed to clarify the subject matter here?

Adam

communications.subject: Public Records Request P-20269
communications.communication:
August 8, 2023


Adam Allen
111440-93925695@requests.muckrock.com


Dear Adam Allen,

I am writing in follow up to previous response sent to you regarding your public records request,
P-20269.  The last response sent to you regarding this request was April 29, 2021, when you were notified of a court order issued that prohibited DOC from providing you the records requested.  There is still an injunction in place that prohibits us from releasing records at this time, however, I am following up to see if you still wish to obtain the records requested or if you would like to alter your request in any way so that we can have responsive records gathered and ready for release when the case is resolved.

If we receive no response from you within 15 days, on or before, August 23, 2023, we will assume you no longer wish to pursue the request and we will consider the request withdrawn.

Sincerely,

Sheila Lawlor
Washington State Department of Corrections
7345 Linderson Way SW
Tumwater, WA 98501



Sheila Lawlor
Information Governance
Records & Information Management
WA State Department of Corrections
sheila.lawlor@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:sheila.lawlor@doc1.wa.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P-20269
communications.communication:
Followup Re: P-20269 information request 
Originally filed: April 23, 2021
Last contact date: August 8, 2023
Re: restraining order status?

Back in 2021, I filed a FOIA request looking for more detailed information on WA DOC and assignment of trans inmates. I found out that there was a court case (Does v. DOC, et al: USDC Cause No. 4:21-cv-05059) with a restraining order prohibiting release of information regarding trans inmates and related issues. So my FOIA request couldn't be fulfilled at that time. Just as a summary, the original request was for:

1. The total number of transgender individuals who are currently incarcerated in a DOC facility broken down by "trans men" and "trans women".
2. What facility DOC houses trans individuals at.
3. Number of transgender individuals housed in solitary confinement and/or isolation from 2010-2020. 

For clarification on number 2, what I'm looking for is any sort of policy or directive, email, or other writing showing a practice of "trans female inmates go to (X) facility, trans male inmates go to (Y) facility". An example, from what I've heard, trans women tend to go to Monroe. But no one seems to know where trans men go. And I'm wondering if that's an unwritten practice that developed over time or policy.

So I thought I'd check in and see if the restraining order has been lifted and that information is now available to be released.
Thank you
Adam Allen

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P-20269

The staff member who has the lead on all requests related to this case is unfortunately out of the office until December 1, however, I have forwarded his email to their office marked for their urgent response.
Thank you,

Sheila Lawlor

communications.subject: public records request re: transgender  (P-57617)
communications.communication:
Adam Allen,

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request received in our office on December 2, 2025. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-57617.

You requested the following records:

1. The total number of transgender individuals who are currently incarcerated in a DOC facility broken down by "trans men" and "trans women".
2. What facility DOC houses trans individuals at.
3. Number of transgender individuals housed in solitary confinement and/or isolation from 2010-2020.

For clarification on number 2, what I'm looking for is any sort of policy or directive, email, or other writing showing a practice of "trans female inmates go to (X) facility, trans male inmates go to (Y) facility". An example, from what I've heard, trans women tend to go to Monroe. But no one seems to know where trans men go. And I'm wondering if that's an unwritten practice that developed over time or policy.

Regarding item #2: I believe there are several factors that determine where transgender individuals are housed. I will search for DOC forms, policies, and memos related to housing transgender inmates.

I anticipate providing records to you within 32 business days, on or before January 27, 2026.

Sincerely,

Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist
Employee & Business Support Services Administration
Washington State Department of Corrections

communications.subject: public records request re: transgender (P-57617)
communications.communication:
Adam Allen,

This letter is regarding your public records request, tracking # P-57617. There are 133 pages of records identified as being responsive to your request and attached to this email.

These records are provided to you in accordance with the Public Records Act. By making agency documents available to you, the Department is not responsible for your use of the information or for any claims or liabilities that may result from your use or further dissemination.

Your request is now closed. The PRA's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run as of the date of this letter. Please contact me within 30 days if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist
Employee & Business Support Services Administration
Washington State Department of Corrections

title: Shang Hassen DOGE CA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Shang Hassen DOGE CA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communication Any and all communications between employees of the Bureau of Reclamation's headquarters office and/or employees of its California regional office and any one of the following individuals associated with the Department of Government Efficiency: Tyler Hassen and/or Bryton Shang. This requests seeks records produced  since January 10, 2025. It seeks texts, emails, notes or transcripts of phone calls, notes, transcripts or recordings of Zoom or Microsoft Team meetings, as well as any chats or DMs from Microsoft Teams, Signal or other messaging apps. This request also seeks any calendar entries of meetings between BOR staff and the individuals named above. 

I am a reporter for The Nation magazine and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: New Message :: L002470-110525
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Public Records Request – Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS/Drones) Request Number: [Insert Request #, e.g., #L004444-012626] Requester: Chris Martin (MuckRock) 

Dear Mr. Martin, 

The Multnomah County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) has processed your request for records. 

MCSO has received your payment for this request. Thank you. 

All responsive materials have been successfully uploaded to the GovQA Public Records Portal. 

Please be advised that MCSO does not upload documents directly to third-party websites or external platforms (such as MuckRock). 

To retrieve your documents, please log in to the primary MCSO Public Records Center via GovQA using your credentials. From there, you will be able to download the electronic files in their entirety. 

If you require assistance accessing these documents or encounter any technical difficulties with the portal, please notify our office by replying to this thread. 

As all responsive materials have been provided, this matter is now considered closed. 

Sincerely, 

Public Records Unit Multnomah County Sheriff’s Office

title: Jurisdiction clarification for Lionel Villa Carmona (Washington State Gambling Comission)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Jurisdiction clarification for Lionel Villa Carmona (Washington State Gambling Comission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting clarification of jurisdiction and what parameters are within policy for employee Lionel Villa Carmona (Leonel) to be involved with in regards to Yakima County. 
This individual was present at the scene of an incident in Moxee, WA, dressed in baggy street clothes, and participating in a Search Warrant executed by the Yakima County Sheriff's Department. This individual is seen from the angle of another person's BWC, trying to unlock tiny lock boxes with keys found around the property, additionally tossing about the personal belongings of an entire house, in a reckless, damaging and unprofessional manner, showing little to no regard for preservation and documentation of the items found and seized. He is also seen tampering with a cell phone found on a computer table and reading through personal letters/papers. None of which is permitted via the Search Warrant. 

A ton of time was spent loitering the area, alongside Trevor Herrud from WSP, AND Cole Hecker from Grandview from about 15:00 to 18:40. Lionel left no supplemental narratives of being present at this incident, but was mentioned by one officers narrative report. The aftermath of this Search and Seizure execution is volatile. 

 Lionel Carmona has recently been included in an WSCJTC complaint that is undergoing an investigation with Yakima County Internal Affair's dept, alongside 13 other officers. 

Please let me know if there is additional information I can provide, at your request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Candace B Cupples

communications.subject: GMB Public Records Request #202601-PRR-03
communications.communication:
Dear Candace B Cupples:

The Washington State Gambling Commission (GMB) received your request for records after normal business hours on January 17, 2026. Your request will be processed as a public records request and, as such, this letter responds to your request under RCW 42.56.520 and WAC 230-21. Please refer to the Request ID# identified above when contacting this office about your request.

You asked for copies of the following GMB records:
Requesting clarification of jurisdiction and what parameters are within policy for employee Lionel Villa Carmona (Leonel) to be involved with in regards to Yakima County.

Due to current workloads, the number of other pending requests and the scope of your request, we estimate it could take up to 30 business days to find, review, and copy any available records and, to the extent necessary, notify persons identified in the records under WAC 388-01-140. On or about March 3, 2026, you may anticipate a response from GMB. Records will be produced in installments as appropriate.

GMB has adopted rules pursuant to RCW 42.56.120(2)(b) related to charges for producing records in response to public records requests. GMB may charge for copies of electronic records, actual cost of other copies, and postage (these rules are available at WAC 230-21-016<file://gmbfloly01/records/Templates-Exemptions-FeeCalculator/WAC%20230-21-016>). As of July 1, 2024, GMB will be charging fees in accordance with our fee schedule for all requests that involve more than one installment. A copy of the fee schedule can be found at GMB_Public_Records_Fee_Schedule.pdf (wa.gov)<https://wsgc.wa.gov/sites/default/files/2023-11/GMB_Public_Records_Fee_Schedule.pdf>.

If you have any questions, please contact me.

Sincerely,


[The official logo and seal of the Washington State Gambling Commission, in dark blue on a white background.]
Allyson 'Al' Roberts
Public Records Officer, Legal and Records Unit
Protect the public by ensuring that gambling is legal and honest.
Email:
Web:
allyson.roberts@wsgc.wa.gov<mailto:allyson.roberts@wsgc.wa.gov>
WSGC.wa.gov<http://wsgc.wa.gov/>
PO Box 42400
Olympia, WA 98504-2400

communications.subject: GMB Public Records Request# 202601-PRR-03: Request Complete
communications.communication:
Dear Candace B Cupples:

The Washington State Gambling Commission (GMB) received your request for records after normal business hours on January 17, 2026. Your request will be processed as a public records request and, as such, this letter responds to your request under RCW 42.56.520 and WAC 230-21. Please refer to the Request ID# identified above when contacting this office about your request.

You asked for copies of the following GMB records:
Requesting clarification of jurisdiction and what parameters are within policy for employee Lionel Villa Carmona (Leonel) to be involved with in regards to Yakima County.
Response
The records at the below link are being provided in response to your request and have not been redacted or deleted. Records will be available to download for 30 calendar days from date of this letter.

Link: https://gamblingcommission.box.com/s/fan8lrm3lx4f5m7o42phkaw8lsjzlmkr

This is the last installment of records in response to your request. Your request has been fulfilled by the production of records (including any exemptions claimed) and is now closed. This is our final response. The GMB does not intend to further address the request, and the PRA's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run as of the date of this letter. Please contact me within 30 days by e-mail or at the address below, if you have any questions.

This concludes the GMB's response to your request and the matter is now considered closed.

Anytime a request is "open" and on-going, a Requester can ask a program to review and modify/change a redaction.  This is not considered an appeal, it is considered regular communication related to a request.  See WAC 388-01-130.

If you disagree with this determination or any redactions made during the production of any of the records by GMB Public Records, you may ask for review, by writing to:

               Adam Amorine, Legal Manager
               Washington State Gambling Commission
               PO BOX 42400
               Olympia, WA  98504-2400

If you have any questions, please contact me.

Sincerely,


[The official logo and seal of the Washington State Gambling Commission, in dark blue on a white background.]
Allyson 'Al' Roberts
Public Records Officer, Legal and Records Unit
Protect the public by ensuring that gambling is legal and honest.

Web:
